text: Harry Campbell (born 16 November 1995) is a professional footballer who played as goalkeeper for Burton Albion. Having spent 10 years at his boyhood club Blackburn Rovers and a spell as a professional at Bolton Wanderers, Campbell joined Burton in 2016. Campbell made his professional debut in the EFL Cup on 28 August 2018 coming on as a 31st minute substitute for the injured regular keeper, Stephen Bywater. Campbell made a last-minute penalty save from Albert Adomah to help earn Burton a 1–0 upset win against the team from a higher division. Campbell was released from Burton at the end of the 2018–19 season. ==References== Category:1995 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Blackburn Category:Blackburn Rovers F.C. players Category:Bolton Wanderers F.C. players Category:Burton Albion F.C. players Category:English Football League players Category:Association football goalkeepers Category:English footballers
title: Harry Campbell (footballer, born 1995)
